oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Evidence for the revival of superconductivity in nd1.82ce0.18cuo4-delta by doping with divalent alkaline-earth elements
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: SINGH, OG
PRAKASH, O
PADALIA, BD
NARLIKAR, AV
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The revival of superconductivity in the electron-excess T'-type compound Nd1.82Ce0.18CuO4-delta by hole doping has been observed. The normal-state resistivity (rho) changes from semiconducting (drho/dT < 0) to metallic (drho/dT > 0) as the hole doping increases up to a certain level.
